<JD_START>
Job Title: Assistant Product Manager

Location: Pennsylvania, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Location: Etters, Pennsylvania Department: Product Management Posted: 04/18/2024 Location Name: Valley Green

Wage: Depends on Experience Position Type: Full Time

Position: Assistant Product Manager

Location: Etters, PA

Amphenol High Speed Products Group is the market leader for high speed, high bandwidth electrical connectors for the Telecom/Datacom market (Mobile Networks, Storage, Servers, Routers, Switches, etc.). Our products help to enable the electronics revolution and remain a key enabler for all the major Tier 1 OEMs globally. We are currently seeking an Assistant Product Manager to join our Product Management and Marketing team. The position will be located in Valley Green, PA.

Summary

We are seeking an Assistant Product Manager in our Cabled Backplane Systems team who can support our product management team and customers with daily tasks and work cross functionally with engineering, quality, production, customer service, and other functions on various product lines.

Responsibilities

Supporting RFQs, RFPs, as well as costing and pricing of product linesManaging product sampling for customers including managing and communication of schedules to customersManage product PCN'sMonitoring on-going cost reduction and implementationAssisting on product requests from customers & sales teamDeveloping marketing materials including product datasheets, press releases, and other online or printed marketing collateralEnsuring quality and other functions provide timely responses to customer quality concernsDeveloping sales and marketing tools, providing technical assistance to customers and sales teamData analysis of product sales including tracking of revenue/margin by product/part number/region/customerJob-related travel may be required

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Bachelor's in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering preferred2+ years related experience, ideally within the interconnect industryExcellent organizational and communication skills, ability to lead and navigate dynamic environments Technical aptitude, including ability to read mechanical drawingsProficiency in Microsoft office products such as Outlook, Excel, and PowerPointAbility to work cross-functionally with global and multicultural teams in marketing, engineering, quality, manufacturing, vendors, and customers

Amphenol Corporation is proud of our reputation as an excellent employer. Our main focus is to provide the highest level of support and responsiveness to both our employees and our customers, the world's largest technology companies. Amphenol Corporation offers the opportunity for career growth within a global organization. We believe that Amphenol Corporation is unique in that every employee, regardless of his or her position, has the ability to positively impact the business.

Amphenol is an "Equal Opportunity Employer" - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin

For additional company information please visit our website at https://www.amphenol-cs.com/

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
